## Current Projects

### Biostatistics

* NIH [BD2K](https://commonfund.nih.gov/bd2k) fellow

* Working with National Veterans Health Administration databases, linked to Medicare, Medicaid, and National Death Index data to examine [diabetes medications and their association with heart failure risk](http://jaha.ahajournals.org/content/6/4/e005379.short)

* developing methods for clarifying and contextualizing [sensitivity to unmeasured confounding analyses](https://www.slideshare.net/LucyDAgostinoMcGowan/clarifying-and-contextualizing-sensitivity-to-unmeasured-confounders-tipping-point-analyses)

* propensity score analysis methods

* developing methods for large scale inference


### R packages

* [googledrive](https://github.com/tidyverse/googledrive): an R package that interfaces with Google Drive from R, allowing users to seamlessly manage files on Google Drive from the comfort of their console. 

### Shiny Apps

* [papr](https://jhubiostatistics.shinyapps.io/papr/): Tinder for pre-prints, a Shiny Application developed in collaboration with [Jeff Leek](http://twitter.com/jtleek) and [Nick Strayer](http://twitter.com/nstrayer) for collecting gut-reactions to pre-prints from the scientific community 

* [Binomial Coverage](https://lucy.shinyapps.io/BinomialCoverage/): an application to facilitate an understanding of coverage probability.

* [contributr](http://ropensci.shinyapps.io/contributr): an application developed in collaboration with [Maelle](http://twitter.com/masalmon) and [rOpenSci](http://ropensci.org) for finding beginner GitHub issues to contribute to. 

* [Tidy Text GUI](https://lucy.shinyapps.io/tidy-text-GUI/):  a tool for analyzing text based on 'Text Mining with R: A Tidy Approach' by Julia Silge and David Robinson, found [here](http://tidytextmining.com).
